page.title: 05Landscape and Buildings
page.content: Saxilby High Street has everything! Friendly people, houses, post office, food and general supplies, butchers, news agent, electrical goods, fish and chips, offices, Memorial Village Hall, 1 pub, riding stables, modern fire station, car sales area, small public garden, made and maintained by the Gardeners' Club and a chemist and dress shop. There is an undertaker's workshop in the 19th cent. blacksmiths shop, a colourful new village sign and a 20th century Methodist Chapel. A railway signal in an enthusiasts garden adds an amusing touch. Off the High Street are the library and health centre. The school adjoins the 7 acre recreation field which has its own clubroom. Nearby, there is a ball bearings factory. The small police station is on Mill Lane. There are 2 pubs and more shops on the waterfront.
